instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage, no audio output
threads.message:
this came in with liquid near <CHIP>U7370</CHIP>, trackpad connector , and <CHIP>U2890</CHIP>, cleaned it, mac boot up. but no audio devices.
there's very little information about audio issues on this model..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage, no audio output
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage, no audio output
threads.message: well speaker works, but headphone jack got a very loud static noise, but i still can hear the actual sound is played, i don have any clue where to start.., both side of  L6602 and l6600 is shorted to ground, I have removed the filter, but one side still have short, its either the headphone jack connector or inside the board, am i correct ? or is this normal ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage, no audio output
threads.message:
Headphones output pass through L6606/8.
L6600/2 connect to ground, depending of what is inserted in the audio jack.

Did you try another audio board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage, no audio output
threads.message: yes I did, it does the exact same thing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage, no audio output
threads.message:
So, L6606/8 have both 0 ohm?
You should have something more affected by corrosion.
Check all small coils and surrounding components of <CHIP>U6300</CHIP>.
